author: leosutic
msg: java.util.Calendar.getTimeInMillis(). Under JDK1.4 this method has public
access, but under JDK1.3 it is protected.
Fix is to use the Calendar.getTime() method to obtain a java.util.Date and
then use Date.getTime() to get the time in milliseconds.
